meanings.definition: To make conventional or conform to established customs or practices.
meanings.sent1: She conventionalizes her attire for work by wearing a suit every day.
meanings.sent2: The school uniform policy conventionalizes the students' clothing choices.
meanings.sent3: At the costume party, he conventionalizes his outfit by wearing a tie over his superhero costume.
meanings.sent4: Her strict upbringing conventionalizes her approach to parenting.
meanings.sent5: The artist conventionalizes his style to appeal to a wider audience.

meanings.definition: To make something conform to traditional or accepted standards.
meanings.sent1: The committee conventionalizes the proposal to meet industry standards.
meanings.sent2: He conventionalizes his speech to fit the formal occasion.
meanings.sent3: The chef conventionalizes the recipe by adding a classic twist to it.
meanings.sent4: The company conventionalizes its marketing strategy to attract more customers.
meanings.sent5: She conventionalizes her artwork to align with the current trends.
